TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed StandardAccessRights extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies a set of standard access rights that correspond to operations common to most types of securable objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights> class provides access rights for common operations, such as deleting, reading, and writing. The precise meaning of each member is specific to the object type to which it is applied.
<xref:System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights> is one of two enumerations to which the <xref:System.Messaging.GenericAccessRights> enumeration maps extensive read, write, or execute abilities. <xref:System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights> enables you to specify rights common to most objects, for example, deleting the object or reading a security descriptor.
Both <xref:System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights> and <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueueAccessRights> provide a member for deleting a queue. The needs of the application define which set of flags you use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights All = int32(2031616)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights Delete = int32(65536)

Docs.summary: The right to delete the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights Execute = int32(131072)

Docs.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor. On Windows 2000 and Windows NT, the security descriptor contains the security information for a securable object. It identifies the object's owner and primary group. is currently defined to equal .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights ModifyOwner = int32(524288)

Docs.summary: The right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights Read = int32(131072)

Docs.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor. is currently defined to equal .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights ReadSecurity = int32(131072)

Docs.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights Required = int32(851968)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights Synchronize = int32(1048576)

Docs.summary: The right to use the object for synchronization. This enables a thread to wait until the object is in a specific state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights Write = int32(131072)

Docs.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor. is currently defined to equal .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.StandardAccessRights WriteSecurity = int32(262144)

Docs.summary: The right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the security descriptor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DACL controls access to the object. Being able to write to the DACL gives the user the ability to set security for the object.
